name: TPC - Flying Leaves Balcony (free parking)
summary: Practical and conveniently located 2 bedrooms flat with all amenities for a comfortable stay. Centrally located to enjoy all the city has to offer! In this apartment can sleep up to 4 people comfortably. Free parking in garage included! Close to Carolina Michaelis metro station. Air conditioner included! Free Wifi is available on all areas of the apartment. Free luggage storage at The Porto Concierge - Welcome Center.

house_rules: - Smoking is not allowed inside the apartment, only in the balcony when available or at the window-sill.  Please leave all electric appliances turned off, make sure water taps are not running and close all doors and windows before check-out.  We request that guests leave the dishes and the kitchen clean and empty out the trash, there is always a garbage deposit in the street nearby.  The apartment is cleaned prior to each arrival. Please, keep the apartment tidy and clean as reasonably possible during all the time of your occupancy. If you require  extra cleaning during your stay, please contact us - we will arrange it.  PLEASE TAKE CARE of the decoration items, furniture, towels/linen and other apartment’s equipment. Any doubts handling the apartment’s appliances and equipment please  call.  The neighbors appreciate some peace and quiet as do our guest, please keep the noise level to a minimum between 22h and 8h.  Use the place as if it were your own.  Check out time is at 11h.  The p

host.host_about: The Porto Concierge ajuda os proprietários de imóveis que pretendem alugar as suas casas mas não têm a possibilidade de receber os seus convidados. Alugar uma casa é um trabalho árduo: garantir a sua limpeza e a manutenção da casa, receber os seus convidados quando chegam e estar disponível para eles durante a estadia. Se vive longe ou se simplesmente não tem tempo suficiente para fazer tudo isso, não se preocupe, nós podemos ajudar.

address.government_area: Cedofeita, Ildefonso, Sé, Miragaia, Nicolau, Vitória

reviews.comments:
O apartamento localizado numa rua muito central e de fácil acesso, é muito agradável e confortável, totalmente equipado e com todas as comodidades desejáveis. 
O bairro é muito tranquilo e perto do centro da cidade. 
Na rua, praticamente à porta, existe um supermercado, uma farmácia e cafés e restaurantes abertos até tarde.
Muito perto da casa há, também, uma estação de metro.  
Quando voltar ao Porto vou certamente querer ficar neste apartamento.

Nous avons passé un très agréable séjour. Nous avons été très bien accueillis et notre hôte s'est montré très disponible. L'appartement, qui se trouve dans un quartier calme, est à 15 ou 20 minutes à pied du coeur de Porto, ce qui permet de se promener même tard le soir et de découvrir les différents visages qu'offre la ville sans regarder sa montre. 
Merci Carlos, et nul doute que si nous retournons à Porto c'est d'abord à vous que nous adresserons en premier.
I didn't see Carlos personally, but everything was perfect. The apartment is pretty big, we were 2 couples and it was perfect for this combination. I'd come again.
Ideal para familia con niños

By far, this was our WORST AirBnB experience!
When we arrived at the apartment, nobody was there. We phoned and were told somebody would come in the next 20 minutes. After having waited 2 hours in the street with kids on a vrey hot day, the cleaning ladies opened the doors for us.
We then discovered the apartment hadn't been cleaned: the floor was dirty, the beds unmade, etc. (it was 7PM...)
We were asked to go out and come back later so that they could do their job.
It was only at 8.30 PM that we could go back to the apartment and finally sit down.
Nobody gave us any clear instruction concerning the apartment as there was nobody for the check-in (the cleaning ladies told us they didn't know what to tell us). So, this is how we later discovered where the parking was and that we had paid for parking in the street for nothing, as it was (supposed to be) included with the apartment.
When we later  phoned the company in charge of the apartment, they never apologized to us and refused to offer us a compensation, even if we had lost half a day with their carelessness.
Concerning the apartment itself, the place is cozy.

So, in a nutshell, if you are willing to risk losing half a day of your trip for an apartment, if you don't care about service at all and don't mind waiting in the street until somebody finally shows up hours later, this could be the place.
However, if you wish to enjoy every minute of your stay and hope to be treated with respect, I'd clearly advise you to go somewhere else (even if the pictures are appealing)...

Logement bien placé , accès centre ville rapide . Spacieux, propre  et bien adapté pour 4 personnes .
Nous n'avons malheureusement pas fait la connaissance de Carlos .
La société de concierge nous a bien reçu et rassuré si problème .

Nice house relatively close to the center (just around 15 min walking). The hosts were very kind :) and there is only a little point to be improved, there are lots of seagulls very early in the morning and the noise is noticeable, though it depends on your capacity to sleep deeply. Double windows would help to solve this, everything else was fine :)

Apartamento en barrio tranquilo a unos 15 minutos andando del centro. El parqué suena un poco y las camas no son muy cómodas. La cocina es algo antigua y el lavavajillas no funcionaba. No había jabón para lavar los platos ni cerillas o encendedor para la cocina de gas. El anfitrión tardó mucho en responder a mis mensajes y en ocasiones no respondió, por lo que tuve que llamar varias veces para que me hicieran caso cuando tuve algún problema; la gestión la lleva una empresa, no el propietario directamente, por lo que están ocupados con la gestión de otros pisos también.
A pesar de todo, diría que a nivel global la calidad es aceptable por el precio pagado.

Well-equipped apartment with parking space in the basement and located near to a supermarket (next-door) and 15 min away from the city centre (by foot). Welcoming host available for his guests and answering quickly to their requests (concierge). However the apartment is a bit noisy. The room windows (street side) are bad soundproofing and neighbour's dogs barking at night (courtyard side) may bring broken sleep. Fortunately, the latter can be mitigated by closing the hall door.
Très bien appartement très propre quartier tranquille à 10 min à pied du centre ville je recommande
Great stylish apartment - spacious and with all we needed... misunderstanding about checking in, but team did all they could to meet our need anyhow.

El apartamento es correcto y bastante limpio. Incluye plaza en garaje privado y toallas/jabones. Está algo apartado del centro histórico y hace imprescindible el uso de transporte público (unos 15 minutos).

La zona es residencial. No tiene oferta de ocio cercana (bares, restaurantes...), sí un supermercado.

El apartamento incluye cocina equipada pero no tiene calefacción, sólo una estufa de gas. Si se visita en invierno las habitaciones se quedan bastante frías.

Anfitrião muito atencioso, atendia nossas ligações sempre é esclarecia quaisquer dúvidas. O apartamento é lindo e confortável! Tem tv a cabo, cozinha super equipada e varanda. As camas eram bem confortáveis! O apartamento está à 15 minutos de caminhada do centro. O chefe in foi bastante informativo e atencioso, pois recebemos uma garrafa de vinho na chegada e também mapas :) recomendo muito este local :)

appartement vraiment conforme aux photos et très confortable . Tout équipé nous n'avons manquer de rien et le petit balcon au calme est très appréciable pour prendre son café en écoutant les mouettes !accueil très chaleureux .
seul bémol : pour nous un peu trop éloigné du centre (20-25m à pied ) même si en échange c'est un quartier calme ! tout à proximité cependant :petit supermarché juste en bas ,boulangerie et centre commercial à 10m . station de métro à même pas 5m. 
nous avons passé un super séjour merci!

Appartement bien situé (en 20 minutes à pied en hyper centre avec des enfants).
Appartement propre (hormis une salle de bain plutôt vieillissante)
Accueil impeccable, équipe disponible.
Muy buena ubicación para ir andando a cualquier parte. El apartamento muy limpio y responde a las fotos que están colgadas

Okay place but nothing special. We expected more for that money and because of the pretty fotos. 
We would not book it again and don't recommend it.
It was not cleaned when we arrived. No beds made. No fresh towels. Simply not cleaned yet. The cleaners came in and cleaned quickly but not very well.
The 2 babybeds that we had asked for when we booked were no there either. We had to call to ask for them.  They were delivered very late when the kids allready slept.
The next day we realized that the fridge did not work and had to through our most of our food. 
The bed in the small room squeaks horribly.
The apartment is noisy with the street and the neighbours.
There were no kitchen towels or dishwashing liquid. 
The couch is rather dirty. 
The bathroom a bit mouldy.
Very easy to find and access from the airport. Great flat with a nice balcony and very friendly check in, would highly recommend!
Great location. Closer to the supermarket. We reálky appreciated the air conditioning.

El piso no concuerda con las fotos, como una de las habitaciones o el salón y los de la agencia dejaron mucho que desear, ya que no dábamos encontrado el sitio y no supieron indicarnos, ya que no nos entendíamos, una vez que encontramos el sitio estuvimos esperando una hora a que llegaran.
Appartement propre et bien situé(supérette à coté et à 15 minutes à pied du centre)Bon accueil!

Very Nice and large placeclose to everything. We enjoy our stay at Carlos s place a lot. We are a 
Family of 4 from Denmark ☀️and  we enjoy Porto so much- we will be back!

En general bien. La zona es en pleno centro de negocios de Oporto, zona tranquila y muy segura.
La limpieza era mediocre, el sofá estaba sucio y la ducha no tenía muy buenas pintas. Por lo demás todo bien, buena comunicación con el anfitrión y el piso en general está bastante bien. Un sitio agradable.
Très facile de rejoindre le centre de porto depuis cet appartement, quartier très calme, je recommande !

Appartement confortable avec toutes les commodités - Métro à proximité, 10 minutes de trajet jusqu'à Sao Bento - Stationnement en sous-sol, accès aux belles plages de Leça de Palmera en 20 minutes - A 20 minutes du centre à pied.
Des halles où on déguste de bonnes choses proche de la Casa da Musica.
Très bien pour nous et nos 2 enfants.
Apartamento exatamente como nas fotos. O proprietário foi muito atencioso e nos recebeu com um vinho da região e etc. Adoramos a estadia.

Logement bien situé par rapport à la ville. Garage en sous-sol et accès pas facile en voiture. Beaucoup de bruit chien qui aboie jour et nuit les voisins que l'ont entends parler depuis la chambre à coucher assez désagréable. Appartement style ancien.

Appartement assez vétuste et sombre 
Calors était très sympathique

Appartement très bien situé proche d'une station métro (100m) supérette juste à côté, boulangerie 
Appartement bien équipé 
Tout fonctionne !
Idéal : Parking sous sol fermé 
Ascenseur

Logement très propre. Nous avons été bien accueillis je recommande l'endroit puis notre hôte nous a conseillé les lieux à visiter.
Merci pour tout
Een mooi appartement op een toplocatie in Porto. Alleen jammer dat er weinig schoonmaakmiddelen waren en de koelkast kapot was. Al met al een goede locatie voor een redelijke prijs

Die Wohnung ist zentral gelegen und sehr geräumig. wir haben uns sehr wohl gefühlt. Es ist alles vorhanden was man benötigt.  Nur die Küche könnte etwas sauberer sein. Wir würden jederzeit wieder kommen.
Un petit marché tout près

L'appartement est bien situé, à proximité du tramway. En quelques minutes, il est possible de rejoindre le centre historique.
La conciergerie est très disponible, flexible sur les horaires, et très attentive. 
L'appartement est grand et bien aménagé.

The apartment was nice, we really like the private underground parking garage for our rental car.  We had a little problem with an elevator but that was a building issue, which was resolved quickly for a weekend call.  Carlos was kind to extend our check out for the inconvenience with the elevator.  Thank you again for that ;-)
Muito bom, limpo, bem localizado, se voltar ao Porto tentarei retornar ao apartamento.

Casa agradável na sala mas com diversos problemas. As camas são de péssima qualidade e é impossível não acordar com o barulho que fazem só de nos virarmos. Os azulejos da cozinha foram pintados e derretem quando se cozinha, reportamos e nada foi feito. O isolamento da casa é muito mau, conseguia ouvir tudo dos vizinhos inclusive perceber a nacionalidade da vizinha. Os carros a passarem na rua parece que estamos numa tenda junto à estrada. Não recomendo.
Excelente imóvel, bem localizado e com garagem privada, o que é difícil da região. Imóvel é bem conservado e com bastantes comodidades. Voltaria a ficar nele.
Excelente localização, próximo a tudo que precisamos. Recomendo

Hemos estado muy a gusto en el apartamento . Nos recibió Gonzalo quién comprobó que todo funcionara correctamente en el apartamento a nuestra llegada. El apartamento es cómodo y tal como aparece en las fotografías. Que el garaje esté incluido es también una ventaja ya que fuimos en coche. 
Está muy cerca de la estación de metro Carolina Michaelis y tiene un supermercado al lado. Totalmente recomendable
Visitez la  ville  de  PORTO  (superbe)  en  allant  chez  CARLOS  .
Everything was very good! We had a great stay!

El apartamento desde el primer momento cumplió con todas nuestras expectativas. Se sitúa cerca del centro de Oporto, y tiene plaza de garaje propia. La recepción se demoró más de lo esperado(en la página pone entrada a las 12h, pero no tuvimos acceso hasta las 14h en adelante. A pesar de todo fue una estancia muy agradable, cómoda y sus recomendaciones fueron muy acertadas.

This is a nice place! The private parking is amazing as it is very hard and expensive to find parking in Porto! This is an airbnb run by a business so the communication wasn’t so personal and had several automated messages and links to their (Hidden by Airbnb) . But in the end who cares :) we had a great time and would come again!
Belmemplacement. grand appartement
Appartement très bien situé dans Porto, propre et d'une très belle surface.  Les commerces situés à proximité sont un vrai plus.

L'appartement est très bien situé, très propre, et contient tout les équipement nécessaires. Nous avions un problème avec l'eau chaude qui a été immédiatement reglé une fois signalé.
Toutefois, l'isolation des murs n'est pas très efficace (on pouvait entendre les voisins la nuit) et vu qu'on été 2 couples on aurait bien aimé avoir 2 cléfs au lieu d'une seule.
Nous recommandons pas cet appartement, qui bien que grand et bien situé, est un peu hors d'âge: beaucoup de dysfonctionnements, problème de clim et pas très propre.

L'appartement de Carlos est très bien situé, on a pu tout faire à pied. Il est spacieux, très bien équipé, et très propre. La personne qui nous a accueillis a été très gentille et nous a gentiment donné des conseils pour notre voyage. Carlos a été très réactif à la moindre de nos questions et très attentionné. Je recommande totalement cet appartement ! :)

Accueil chaleureux et appartement très sympa !
Malgré notre heure tardive d’arrivée nous avons eu un accueil génial avec une petite bouteille très sympa !
L’appartement est bien agencé agréable et bien placé pour visiter porto ! Merci encore pour tout à Carlos et son équipe !

Apartement tel que décrit, très privé et bien entretenu. Service ultra, hôte très attentif à nos besoins. Je recommande chaudement

Denis

Nice place to visit Porto
Everything was perfect, expect cleanliness.
muy bien con todas las comodifades necesarias
Ótima experiência. Recomendo

Departamento bien situado para llegar andando a cualquier sitio.
La cochera es un plus dado que es muy dificil estacionar en Oporto.
Nos han recibido con un vino de cortesía y la calefacción para la epoca de invierno, esta muy bien.
Buen precio y gran trato
O espaço e acomodação excelentes. Realmente o que mostra e propõe.
O espaço do Carlos atende, mas precisa de uma adequação de itens de cozinha e manutenção.

el apartamento está muy bien ubicado, limpio, se corresponde perfectamente con las fotos, hay de todo tipos de utensilios. lo único que ponía que había que podíamos entrar a las 12am y al final nos dijeron que hasta las 2pm nada, pero por lo demás genial! muy muy recomendable

name: Spacious Room/Private entry and Great Views
summary: Beautiful, clean and fresh private room in the heart of the Kona Coffee Farmlands.  Our property is great for couples, solo adventurers, and small families. Room has one large King Bed, another room can be made available with two single beds and 3/4 Bath.    Great views of the ocean and the mountain.  Four wheel drive, all wheel drive or higher clearance vehicle is required.  I do have a great Jeep for rent too, let me know if you're interested...
space: A small fridge and coffee pot is in the room.  There is a shared fully stocked kitchen and BBQ are available for your use during your entire stay. A Private back lanai and yard for your enjoyment. Their is also a wonderful shared large front Lanai and yard.
description: Beautiful, clean and fresh private room in the heart of the Kona Coffee Farmlands.  Our property is great for couples, solo adventurers, and small families. Room has one large King Bed, another room can be made available with two single beds and 3/4 Bath.    Great views of the ocean and the mountain.  Four wheel drive, all wheel drive or higher clearance vehicle is required.  I do have a great Jeep for rent too, let me know if you're interested... A small fridge and coffee pot is in the room.  There is a shared fully stocked kitchen and BBQ are available for your use during your entire stay. A Private back lanai and yard for your enjoyment. Their is also a wonderful shared large front Lanai and yard. Shared Kitchen  BBQ Private Full room  Private Full Bath Private back lanai and yard. great for yoga, mediation and relaxing. Beautiful private suite. Additional private bedroom with half bath available. Will accommodate one additional guest or two children for minimal cost. Shared Front y
neighborhood_overview: Captain Cook is a small, quaint area.  Two hours to Volcano National Park, 15 miles to Kona, 20 minutes to the shore line, and other great restaurants, shopping and beaches are all within minutes.
notes: You MUST rent a vehicle with high clearance, All-Wheel Drive or four wheel drive.  Our road is private, steep and not completely paved.  It is not 'challenging' though. You will find many areas of the Island require high clearance or four wheel to have the ultimate experience.  A lot great dining close by, grocery store within a mile, hiking, snorkeling, beaches, swimming and more, all close by! The State of Hawaii requires us to collect taxes. There isn't a great way to do this on Airbnb site. It is a total tax of (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) % (4% GET, 9.25% Accommodation). We can add this via a 'special offer' when booking or you can (Hidden by Airbnb) or check upon arrival.  Our License number is TA (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)  While not all hosts are doing this, we want to support Hawaii and be a legal business, keep our prices as low as possible and also want you to know where your money is going.
transit: There is an Island bus to accommodate travelers if needed.  Although slow, the bus does go around the entire Island. A good 4x4 vehicle for the Island is really my recommendation though.
access: Shared Kitchen  BBQ Private Full room  Private Full Bath Private back lanai and yard. great for yoga, mediation and relaxing. Beautiful private suite. Additional private bedroom with half bath available. Will accommodate one additional guest or two children for minimal cost. Shared Front yard and lanai for sunsets and relaxation. Shared Washer and Dryer
interaction: We are available for questions, guidance and whatever else may arise.  I can be as involved or not as you like. The Big Island is a magical place and we want you to experience as much of the Island as possible while here.
house_rules: - Smoking outside is ok - Pets may be considered, inquire - Thera are small stairs to room and kitchen

host.host_about: Adventurer. Pilot. Love and fun seeker

reviews.comments: What a great experience! Greg's place in on a beautiful mountain in Captain Cook.  The view of the ocean and sunsets are magical! Our room was clean and very comfortable. It was so fun to pick and eat the avocado and bananas that grow on the property. Truly a beautiful, peaceful place and a quick easy drive to several wonderful spots to snorkel. Greg was very helpful with ideas for fun local restaurants and shops. We also rented a Jeep from him that we picked up at the airport. Highly recommend a 4wheel drive for the trip up the mountain to the main house as well as some fun, secluded beaches. We love the Big Island of Hawaii and staying at Greg's wonderful mountain getaway only made the experience that much better! Thank you for sharing your slice of Paradise with us! Mahalo

We picked Greg's place because we wanted to experience life in Hawaii more like the locals do and stay in the midst of a coffee farm. What an amazing choice that was! Once you get on top of the hill the view of the front lanai down to the ocean is absolutely incredible! Every morning we enjoyed coffee and avocado toast on our own private lanai with breathtaking views of the coffee fields up the mountain! We picked avos from one of the many trees on the property and were surrounded by other exotic fruit like cherimoya, sapote, pomelo, papaya, passion fruit, bananas and cacao! Greg's place is very peaceful and relaxing and he is the most easy-going and accommodating host. We were glad we rented a jeep from him as well and were able to visit South Point and drive to the top of Mauna Kea. The location was very convenient - only minutes away from an awesome family-owned grocery store and The Green Market on Sundays voted in the top 50 best farmers' markets in the USA. What we enjoyed the most were the peaceful cool mornings and evenings - quite the welcomed contrast with the heat in downtown Kona. I loved doing yoga in the morning by the koi fish pond on the front lanai, marveling the expansive view of the ocean down below. The room has its own separate entrance and so does the kitchen, which was very convenient. We even got to cook some yummy vegan meals with fresh herbs from Greg's garden! It felt like being on a retreat - cannot wait to come back again and stay longer!

If you are looking for a true Hawaiian experience, then this is the place for you!
I think our experience started with our first correspondence with Greg. He answered our questions promptly and accurately, helping us to make our decision to stay. Throughout our entire visit, Greg and Pam were not only accommodating and knowledgable about the island and local area, but helpful beyond expectation! Everything from finding an emergency eye doctor and dentist, to finding secluded beaches with turtles or swimming with the dolphins...they were our best resource.  I think they have found the perfect balance of giving you privacy and being there to make your Hawaiian experience complete! 
As depicted in the photo, the room was clean and comfortable and suited our needs perfectly. It was not only tastefully decorated but carried a positive energy for a very restful stay. The bed was big and comfortable and our favorite part was having coffee and breakfast on our own private balcony each morning, with an amazing view! Even though part of the main house, the room has its own private entrance, therefore it felt like a separate apartment... Which was what we were looking for...perfect. The owners have two very sweet dogs, Captain and Stella, who will greet you in the morning, but are very respectful. 
The property itself has breathtaking views of the mountain and the sea. With that said, you will definitely need a car with higher clearance to get up the mountain. (Ask Greg about his Jeep for rent). There is NO  need for air conditioning  as the location/elevation is much cooler. A wonderful breeze in the evenings and a ceiling fan for the day if necessary. 
From tropical fruit trees, coffee beans, beautiful sunsets....this is an oasis  from everyday life. You will enjoy every minute of your time here. It was difficult to leave! 
Thank you for your wonderful hospitality, we came as guests, we left as friends! 
Mahalo!

It's not just "Hawaii" that might put you under a spell when staying at Greg's place. The adventure of getting up the hill, the jungle like surroundings, the ocean view, the "beach house," is only surpassed by Greg's generosity and true hospitality. Before I even arrived, Greg worked with me on driving directions and my car rental. He met me at the bottom of the hill and if my van could not make it (it did), he planned to use his truck to get me up there. Everything I could need was available to me. His "work-traders" were so kind and helpful. Even though Greg was pulled away during my stay, I was very well taken care of. If you are visiting the west side of Hawaii and enjoy a more original island feel, I strongly suggest you stay south of Kona area in Captain Cook. If you enjoy staying in a nicely appointed large room on a groomed and working tropical farm with friendly folk, then I strongly suggest you stay at Greg's.
Very nice apartment, surrounded by a peaceful coffee plantation with great views. We loved to share our breakfast with the geckos on the lanai and listen to the sounds of nature at night!

This place is a dream.  Greg is an excellent, considerate, chill host.  Greg and Pam thought about little details, like excellent sheets and little fridge in the room.  The room is lovely--spacious and a quiet.  I stayed for a whole week, and so I cooked in the kitchen where there were SHARP knives (never happens in an Air BNB, I've found).  I spent every afternoon I could sitting on the porch, knitting and watching the sun set.  Since it's a working farm, there were work-away folks staying on the property too, and I enjoyed their company.  Everyone is super chill, very polite and friendly, and you can be as social or not as you like.  There were plenty of fresh avocados, cherimoyas, lemons, strawberry guavas, and mamaki tea for me to eat and drink.  Greg pointed me to Da Poke Shack (holy shit!), The Strawberry Patch (awesome), and Annie's Island Fresh Burgers (pretty good).  

The road is no joke.  I've driven on steep mountain roads on ridges in Big Sur with non 4x4s, but I'd recommend a 4x4 just because then you don't have to worry.  Definitely you want a vehicle with high clearance.  Drive slowly out of respect for neighbors, and look out for other cars and the occasional rooster and wild boar.  You definitely want to make sure that you turn right at the rock wall, so double-check with Greg that you know the way up alright.  That said, unless you are a timid or nervous driver, it will be fine.

The dogs are sweet and chill, no problems with barking.  There are roosters around, and the cock-a-doodle all day and night, but these ones were fine and never woke me up.  That's saying a lot since roosters are my arch-nemesis.

Definitely check out:
1. Pu'uhonua o Hanaunau--check out the history, and also walk along the lava south and check out the tide pools and sacred sites.  If you want to hike, bring water (at least 2 liters) and decent shoes and continue the six or so miles along the 1871 trail over to Hookena Bay.  Check out the website big island (Website hidden by Airbnb) for more info and more great hikes.

2. Borrow snorkeling gear from Greg and snorkel at Two Step (also called Honaunau Beach), within walking distance of Pu'uhonua.  If you want to try to swim with dolphins, go to Kealakekua Bay or Hookena (I had luck at Hookena).

3.  Da Poke Shack.  Duuuude.

4. If you're up for adventure, bring a friend and snorkeling gear and go to Honamolino Bay (big island hikes website will tell you info).

5.  Sawittri, who does massage.  Greg left her card in the room.  She's super talented.

6.  The South Kona Farmers Market on Sunday mornings 9-2.  The honey guy closest to the entrance has white honey and Melaleuca (or however you spell it) honey.  It's phenomenal.  

Sigh...I miss it already.  Have a great trip!

Greg's two-acre coffee farm is a lush paradise tucked away into the hillside with amazing ocean views and spectacular sunsets! 

Greg has two very friendly dogs, Stella and Captain, who will lovingly greet you upon your arrival! The room for Airbnb is designed to allow guests to come and go as they please and to have as much privacy as they would like. We had access to the kitchen and there was always fresh kona coffee brewed and ready to drink! We enjoyed our morning coffee everyday on the private lanai overlooking the coffee farm. The property has several different fruit trees that you can pick fruit from when in season. You definitely need a high-clearance or 4-wheel/all-wheel drive vehicle to access the property. There is a grocery store about 5 minutes away, and restaurants and shops about 10 minutes away. Be sure to check out the South Kona fruit stand and grab a fresh fruit smoothie and some other local goodies! Also, be sure to check out Mamalahoa hot tubs for a twilight soak - it's only 10 minutes away!

Greg is extremely knowledgable about the Big Island and helped us to plan our trip. We have been to the Big Island several times before, but with his knowledge and advice, we were able to explore some new areas, which were amazing! Greg provided us with snorkeling equipment, beach towels, a cooler, and anything else that we might have needed during our stay. 

Not only did Greg help us to plan some adventures, but he took us on a couple! He graciously took us fishing and whale watching on his boat on the Kohala Coast, which was amazing, but he somehow topped this adventure by taking us on a private, full moon night flight over the active volcano! This took our breath away!! 

We are so grateful to Greg for making our stay the most memorable one we have had so far! Greg really is just one of the nicest, most humble, people we have ever met and we feel like we left having made another great friend! When we return, we will most definitely be staying with Greg again! 

So in short, we HIGHLY RECOMMEND staying at Greg's private coffee farm for your Big Island stay!
Greg's wife was very welcoming and helpful. The place was clean, nice and confortable. Lot of equipment in the kitchen and the view is just amaaaazing !!

war eine sehr schöne Unterkunft. Die Lage ist grossartig.
Die Gastgeber sehr herzlich. Mahalo für die schöne Zeit.

Read the previous reviews..... they're spot on!

My son and I came to experience something different - we loved every minute of our time on Greg's very special, very inviting property.

The view is amazing, coffee was great, the drive up the mountain was fun, the bed was comfy, and Greg was very accommodating. He helped with transport to and from the airport and added an extra bed to the room for my son. It was a great stay! I definitely recommend this property. Thank you!
Greg's place is awesome! No surprises, everything was exactly as it is described. This is my new favorite place to stay in Captain Cook.
Great place with a great view on high.  Quiet, peaceful and we highly recommend it!  Mahalo!

My mother and I really loved our stay on Greg's farm. We rented both rooms (which are on separate sides of the house). Greg and his friends and farm staff were incredibly friendly and helpful throughout our stay, and shared the bounty of the farm with us (avocados and pomelos during our visit). The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, and the views from both are amazing! We also rented a car from Greg through Turo, and that was very convenient. I'd recommend staying here, especially if you want to be a bit removed from the tourist scene.

We are a family of four with two teenagers.  We picked Greg's place because we were looking for an adventure and wanted a place with real character that wasn't a resort.  We'd read great things about Greg's place and we also really like dogs.  We got exactly what we were looking for, without actually being in a tent.  We'd never been anywhere tropical before so it was fascinating wandering around the property, learning about all the plants that grow there and the process of making chocolate.  On the last night we gathered some of the many avocados and whipped up a tasty guacamole to eat with our tacos in the well stocked kitchen.  The barbecue was excellent, the room very airy, comfortable and efficient.  The kids room was smaller and not joined (a bonus for privacy) and they (a boy & girl) appreciated not having to share a bed which is often the case in many places.

Greg was an excellent host, very laid back and helpful.  On the first night he guided us up the mountain drive via text.  There were a few very friendly "work away" people there and one of them was an excellent co-host, very nice and helpful.  The dogs, Captain and Stella are super sweet and make the place especially welcoming.

We made use of the cooler, snorkel sets, beach mats, boogie board and jeep.  There was also a ton of personal hygiene items left behind by folks who fly in.  Buying things on the island can be a bit pricey so we found having these readily available saved us some money.  The cost of the rental was very good value for a family spending Canadian dollars.  We'd definitely go back.

Greg is very welcoming, the communication was perfect. We were happy to stay in his condo, he provided us everything we needed. It's a quiet place. The access to his housse is a funny road, you will definitely need a 4wd car. The location is a good place to visit this part of the island. This experience brought us a good memories to our holidays

The house is way up on top of a hill. It is very beautiful. The driveway is only accessible by a four eheel drive car, but the host was able to give is a ride up and down the driveway a couple of times.

The room was very clean and well-stocked. Everything was great.
Greg's place is fantastic: remote, peaceful, great view from the common areas, gorgeous natural surroundings. Greg is a super chill, super helpful host. The dogs are the best. Highly recommended!
Beautiful location above the ocean with magnificent views. Greg is a fantastic host. We also rented a car from him, 4wd, best to climb his driveway.

This was first time for us to use Airbnb, I stayed with my friend for 10 days and I enjoyed very much. We rent Greg's car (Subaru Cross treck, 4WD) because 4WD car is necessary to access to his place on the hill. So, its sight is amazing (sunset and stars) and much better than scenic places at roadside . The room is enough comfortable to stay longer. Greg allowed us to use his well-furnished kitchen (e.g., coffee marker, rice cooker, juicer and many kinds of seasonings, Kona coffee....). So, we could cook many kinds of foods easily. We borrowed snorkeling gears, beach towel and cool bag and enjoyed beautiful sea near captain cook. We asked a lot of things to Greg and Aya and they always gave us very nice suggestion for sightseeing. We really want to come back here if we have an opportunity. Thank you very much for everything.

We feel fortunate to have stayed at Greg's place. It's quiet, peaceful and really has the feel of a Hawaiian paradise. The only noises you hear are the Coqui Frogs at night and birds in the morning. Sometimes the clouds rest on the coffee farm a little farther uplslope, giving the back porch view an ethereal quality. The geckos were surprisingly curious and entertaining. We had fun watching them tussle with each other and drink from rainwater on the table. We also especially enjoyed having coffee in the morning on the front porch while looking out over the ocean. It's really hard to hold onto stress in a situation like that.

Captain Cook is about a half-hour drive from Kona. We found though that we didn't need to go down everyday. The town has restaurants, grocery store, farmers markets and roadside stands. Most of our daily papayas and mangoes came from "Cooks Bounty" roadside stand, across the street from Choicemart. You're also not too far from "Two-Step" snorkling, scenic drives and coffee farms with tastings. I wish we had explored the farms a bit more. Greenwell farms is about 10 min away. Greg is also a reservoir of knowledge on things to do in the area. Just ask and you'll have more things to do than you have days to do them.

The road up is a bit challenging and our front-wheel drive Ford Escape would occasionally slip, but when we slowed down and drove with a little more aloha, it didn't seem to be a problem. Also, slowing down allowed to discover the perfectly ripe, giant avocados that fall from a tree on the way up. I don't think we bought another avocado during our stay.

Greg was very helpful and responsive. (Hidden by Airbnb) maps doesn't give accurate directions, so he met us at a parking lot to show us the way up. He was also very responsive to texts and was quick to accommodate.

If you like staying in unique and tranquil places, Greg's is a good one.

This location is awersome! In the middle of a dschungle and it looks exactly like on the image. Greg is a great host, helping with all you need at any time. You will miss something if you don't go there!

Nestled in paradise, Greg's place is a wonderful and tranquil place to spend a vacation. The minute I arrived, I felt like a local and was welcomed warmly by everyone. The house is located in the South Kona coffee belt and is within a few minutes drive to wonderful local beaches such as Ho'okena, Manini, and the best snorkeling on the island down at Two Step. I am so glad I stayed here instead of somewhere near Kona. Even Kona was a short drive away and as I found out, there is a new bypass highway that links Captain Cook to Kona which makes the drive even faster! It was also a convenient location for a day trip to the volcano and South Point. There was a well stocked supermarket right down the street from the house which was stocked with natural and organic products - that was a plus for me as I am vegetarian and love to eat healthy. Cooks Bounty fruit stand across the street was also great for buying local fruits, honey, and coconuts. That coconut water was very refreshing after a morning spent snorkeling! A short drive away, I found a great local organic coffee shop named Kaya's with freshly baked goodies and vegan options (and lots of art by local artists). It was a lovely spot to people watch and meet nice locals. 

The house was clean, colorful, and full of life. I enjoyed the avocados, arugula, tomatoes, herbs, and bananas that grow in the backyard. The dogs were very friendly as were the geckos that seemed very interested in my cup of coffee and plate of fruits each morning. The private patio was a lovely place to have breakfast overlooking Mauna Loa and the coffee fields. There is a lot of positive energy emanating from Mauna Loa and the house is right on the slopes of it. the drive to the house (which is located on a hill) is not that bad after the first time around although it does require a 4WD vehicle (and luckily I rented one from Greg at a great price).

I thoroughly enjoyed my time here. If you're looking for an immersive local experience that is one of a kind, I highly recommend Greg's Airbnb!
Great location in a secluded area. The driveway up is a little rough but that is part of the adventure. If you are looking for a place off the beaten path yet near to Kona this is your answer!

Greg's house uphill is a very special and unique place. We've enjoyed our stay there very much. Even when Greg was at work, his "workaways" (special thank to Lana, Brody and Kory) hosted us so well.  It's good to have a 4WD for the 10 min. drive on the mountain. Beside the nice house the property has a beautiful garden with Macadamia nuts, fresh bananas, herbs and other things. We've tried all fresh from the garden for free. Our room with the balcony was so nice and even on hot summer days there was a cool breeze up there. Greg lend us all the stuff we needed for the beach. Summarizing: If we would make vacation a second time on the Big Island we would definitely stay again in Greg's house. Thanks, Simone + Joe (from Germany)
Greg was extremely friendly & answered all of our questions. The ride up was pretty gnarly but definitely worth the view!

Greg was a very generous host and provided us with tips, fruit from the garden ( macadamion nuts, papayas, bananas ), coffee in the morning, snorkeling gear and umbrella for the beach etc. His estate is amazing and he´s helpful with everything. But we definitely needed a 4WD to climb the road to his house. Highly recommend place to stay on Big Island. Korinna and Sibylle

Prachtige locatie met schitterend uitzicht.  Rustige ligging. Moeilijk begaanbare, steile toegangsweg. Nodigt niet uit om meerdere keren per dag te gebruiken. Zeer gastvrije verhuurder. Echter door werk niet altijd bereikbaar.
Amazing property! Picked fresh fruit and macadamia nuts every morning! Beautiful view of the sunset.

What an amazing place! As you climb up the road surrounded by coffee and avocado trees, you know you're in the right place. The view only gets better as you go up and Greg has made an incredible home up on top of the hill. So much great fruit from the land (avos, oranges, guavas, pomelos, limes, and even thornless Hawaiian raspberry). He knows tons about the area and has lots of great stories. Last but not least, the snorkeling gear was invaluable for our daily expeditions to the beach. Can't wait to go back for our next stay on the Big Island.
Ocean view in the mountain. Great location! So beautiful and peaceful!!!
This is a beautiful spot up amongst the coffee trees. Greg is a very nice host! The summer rise and sunset up here are terrific.  There are lots of wild birds.

We had a delightful time at Greg’s. Enjoyed great views,  sunset on the deck, the fire pit, picking macadamia nuts, avocados, papayas, pineapples and more from his plantings, and not to mention his two lovable dogs. And it close to historic sites and many interesting places to visit.

Greg was a great host, the house sits on 4-5 acres of very quiet hillside with lots of fresh fruit to harvest everyday if you choose to.  Access to snorkels, fins, coolers, umbrellas and beach matts was awesome and the local suggestions for food and markets was spot on! Bring a sweatshirt for the mornings as it's nice and cool but was 80 within 45 minutes of sunrise. Perfect end to a hot day on the water or beach!

The room was very nice, bed good quality.  It was great to have both a private lanai in the back and another shared  one in front for socializing. We stayed a month so shared the kitchen, which was very nice  and well equipped. Greg has all you need for the beach and knows the island very well. And he's a great guy

We had a wonderful stay at Greg’s place. We especially enjoyed the view from the garden, overlooking the ocean from very high up. The room is bright and airy with a great private deck. The feel is very welcoming and everyone at the house could not have been friendlier!

Wir haben uns bei Greg sehr wohl gefühlt. Auf seinem Grundstück wachsen viele Kaffeepflanzen, (Hidden by Airbnb) , Bananen, Annanas... Gregs temporäre Mitarbeiterinnen haben uns viel über die Pflanzen erzählt, was für uns und unsere Kinder sehr interessant war. Geschmeckt hat es auch sehr gut!
Unsere Zimmer waren groß und sehr praktisch eingerichtet. 
Die Gemeinschaftsküche ist ein gemütlicher Ort, um mit den anderen Bewohnern in Kontakt zu kommen.

Le logement est un peu éloigné, mais on peut s'y rendre relativement facilement en Jeep. Le lit était confortable et nous avons apprécié avoir accès à la cuisine, à la laveuse et sécheuse ainsi qu'aux accessoires de plage. La connection internet était extrêmement lente, mais nous pouvions manger plein de bons fruits frais ceuillis :) Si vous voulez expérimenter Big Island comme un habitant local.
This is a really wonderful place to stay, and Greg was an exceptional host.  Would recommend to all my friends and family without hesitation.
greg's place was great. it was a wonderful location near excellent snorkeling on the sunny side of the island. the hosts were super relaxed and very welcoming. it was a great value.

We had a wonderful stay at Greg’s place. The room comes with a huge bed and has lots of space and sunlight. There’s a hilly, slightly harrowing 10-minute drive up to the top of the hill where the house is, but it’s worth it for the views, great location and peaceful atmosphere.

Greg’s place was everything we could ask for. He was a wonderful host.  We also rented a car from him and he went above and beyond to make our pick up and drop of at the airport flawless.  He had great suggestions and knowledge of the island.
Our son can’t stop talking about Greg’s place and his dogs. All the other reviews were spot on, Greg is a super host. This vacation will be one that will not be forgotten.
Greg is a very welcoming host and our stay at his place was great. He is always ready to help and treats well his guests.

This place is amazing! The evening opera of wildlife is like nothing I’ve ever expirienced. Holli and Sam(possible co hosts) have amazing suggestions, truely make you feel at home and will (occasionally) make breakfast. The road up is pretty rough, very “Indiana Jones” and you WILL need 4x4. Eli & Stella are the pups that live up there as well - very friendly and loving. They have pineapple, banana trees, loads of avacado trees, oranges and so much more! Truely accommodating with many amenities. Be prepared for a very small second room with two twins (one on a frame and the other underneath) & you will need to share your shower as there is only one in the main room. Overall, great stay! Be prepared for a 13.25% “lodging tax” that they will throw on to you your very last day. Nothing like Aloha like a $105 extra payment but apparently it’s all over the island. Would absolutely recommend for any 1st time vacationers!

Greg's place is very quiet and serene. The property is lush and the view is spectacular! It is very close in, Keahou Bay is just 15 minutes from the bottom of the driveway.  Spend a couple nights here to experience the quiet side of Hawaii... Greg has good local knowledge and suggestions if you want.

name: Private Sunny Bedroom in a Modern 2 Bedroom Co-op
summary: Enjoy the benefits of peace and quiet in a lovely serene Brooklyn neighborhood, along with the proximity to the hustle and bustle of the world's most fascinating city. You will love this spacious but cozy home away from home near the heart of Brooklyn.
space: ** To get the most out of your stay with us please be sure to read the ENTIRE listing before requesting to book** The room is a beautiful bedroom with original wood floors. Wake-up to the sunlight streaming into this very quiet bedroom. You will enjoy returning to our home after a day of sight seeing or an evening out on the town in New York. Visit Manhattan or stay in Brooklyn and enjoy the beauty, the history and the culture.
description: Enjoy the benefits of peace and quiet in a lovely serene Brooklyn neighborhood, along with the proximity to the hustle and bustle of the world's most fascinating city. You will love this spacious but cozy home away from home near the heart of Brooklyn. ** To get the most out of your stay with us please be sure to read the ENTIRE listing before requesting to book** The room is a beautiful bedroom with original wood floors. Wake-up to the sunlight streaming into this very quiet bedroom. You will enjoy returning to our home after a day of sight seeing or an evening out on the town in New York. Visit Manhattan or stay in Brooklyn and enjoy the beauty, the history and the culture. *We are a shoe-free home. Please remove your shoes upon entering* Your bedroom has a full sized bed, 1 bedside table, 2 small dressers, a shelf and mirror. You can lock your door from the inside only. Shared access to the bathroom with tub and full kitchen including the washer/dryer.  TV with Chromecast and Roku b
neighborhood_overview: SAFETY: A lot of people ask if the neighborhood is safe. I would say the neighborhood is very safe, but like anyplace it's best to use precaution and be aware of your surroundings.
notes: **In order to optimize your guest experience we only accept guests who have read the listing in it's entirety. Please type the phrase: "Queen Angela Lansbury" at the top of your request to let us know you've read the entire listing**
transit: Located conveniently 2 blocks from the F/G at Church ave as well as plenty of buses  Subways & buses run 24 hours a day, but slow down between 12:00am and 6:00am. Download UBER & Lyft for easily accessed rides around the city. Green Taxis can be hailed on the streets in Brooklyn and will take you anywhere in the city. Yellow Taxis can be hailed on the streets in Manhattan and will take you anywhere in the city.
access: *We are a shoe-free home. Please remove your shoes upon entering* Your bedroom has a full sized bed, 1 bedside table, 2 small dressers, a shelf and mirror. You can lock your door from the inside only. Shared access to the bathroom with tub and full kitchen including the washer/dryer.  TV with Chromecast and Roku box in your room as well as in the living room.  We are 2 blocks from the F/G @ Church Ave and Foodtown Supermarket Hardwood Floors - well heated in the Winter & air-conditioned in the Summer. We have AC's in the kitchen, living room and your room. Towels, hair dryer, iron and a new pair of slippers will be in your room upon arrival. We wash all pillow cases, bed sheets, towels and blankets between EVERY reservation.  Pets must be fully housebroken, licensed and fully up to date on immunizations. Pets MUST be approved before booking.
interaction: Guest/Host interaction is mainly up to you. Though we are around, we tend to have minimal interaction unless you have questions. We're happy to help with directions, recommendations and whatever else you may need during your stay.  We will always try our best to be here to greet you. When we are not, we will provide you with detailed instructions to enter the house and a list of great tips to make your stay the best it can be. We are always available by phone or email. Please be assured you can contact us anytime for any reason and we will respond and do our best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.
house_rules: - Check-in time is flexible. CHECK-OUT IS 11:00 A.M. EST.  - Late Check Outs MAY be accommodated if/when necessary. - This is a NON SMOKING unit. There is NO SMOKING anywhere inside the building. - NO DAILY MAID SERVICE - Daily maid service is not included in the rental rate however is available at an additional cost. - Please note: This is our home. Please be mindful of shared spaces. The apartment will be cleaned before your arrival. We expect guests to clean up all shared spaces after use. This includes washing dishes or placing them in the dish washer, disposing of garbage, tidying up dining table after eating and removing hair from shower drain. - Pets are not permitted in the apartment without prior approval. NO EXCEPTIONS. - INCLUSIVE FEES - Amenity fees are included in the rental rate. This includes the use of the washer/dryer and detergents needed for the washer/dryer. - PERSONAL NECESSITIES - Clean linens, towels, cleaning supplies and toiletries are available to you at no co

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about:
We are a gay couple in our 30s looking to share our home with folks of any race, sexual orientation & gender. We also have 2 super friendly cats. 

I (Lori-on the right, with sunglasses) work as a 1 on 1 for preschool children with special needs (SEIT). I travel all over Brooklyn and Manhattan with my backpack full of crayons, stickers and games, helping one kid at a time. I'm a big foodie and even grow some of my own organic herbs in the apartment. I love to cook & bake and typically prepare paleo and whole30 approved meals.  

I (Jen-on the left) am a teacher and artist who wears many hats in the dance field. I work with middle school, high school and college students of all levels as well as present my work throughout NY and beyond. I also enjoy cooking and have a special knack for organizing. 

Typically we hang with friends, go to shows or enjoy a meal together a few nights a week. When nothing is planned, you'll find us reading, listening to music, watching TV or catching up on paperwork.

reviews.comments: The house is very clean and comfortable. Also the two house holders are very kind. I appreciate it and highly recommend this house.

We were pleasantly surprised when we walked into our room to find towels, slippers and a candy on our bed welcoming us!  Because of our quick stay, we didn't spend much time at the B&B, but honestly wish we could have, just to talk with these lovely ladies more!  
We will definitely remember them the next time we come to visit our son in Brooklyn.  It is in a great location, with a comfortable bed and all the amenities that we needed were there.  Lori, Jen and their 2 adorable cats really made us feel at home!

Everything was exactly as described in the announcement. The appartment is nice, the surroundings are nice as well and the location is convenient.
Lori and Jane are very professional, from A to Z.

They were very friendly and nice. Their home was clean and was true to description and pictures. They were very easy going and hospitable; we were able to come and go as needed without disturbing anyone. Their place was a lovely, safe neighborhood and very close to the subway. The cats were super cute and clean too! We will definitely remember them the next time we're in NYC.

Very cozy and comfortable room, the sunshine is really great. The surroundings are safe and quiet since we usually came back or went out at 9-11pm. The cats are so adorable and super friendly! Lori's painting is really beautiful. The kitchen is tidy and easy to use, so as all the other parts of the house. Lori and Jen are warm and we enjoy talking with them very much! Highly recommend this place.

房子所在的小区非常安静,我们到得很晚,有时候深夜在附近吃饭闲逛,觉得都挺安全的｡她们家小猫简直太萌了,这几天我在曼哈顿上课,课程强度很大,回到家特别累,摸一摸猫咪感觉整个人都好了｡厨房用品和厨具一应俱全,整个房子布置得也很温馨,看得出她们的精心和细致,很有生活情趣｡地铁出行等交通也很方便,来布鲁克林或曼岛,住这儿是非常不错的选择｡

L'appartamento è in una posizione molto comoda, vicino alla fermata della metropolitana e al supermercato. Il quartiere è tranquillo e sicuro, io ero sola e tornavo sempre a casa dopo le 23.00 senza problemi. La casa è accogliente e pulita, ottima la possibilità di usare la lavatrice. I gatti sono socievoli e curiosi, soprattutto Blue! Lori e Jen sono riservate e non invadenti ma sempre cordiali e disponibili a rispondere a ogni domanda.
Great location, very comfortable bed, extremely adorable and friendly cat named Lego! Had a nice stay!
Great stay! Friendly people and cats!

Très bonne première expérience Airbnb. Lori et Jen sont très accueillantes, très sympa et disponible. L'appartement est propre et très agréable avec deux chats très câlins. La chambre est propre, le lit confortable, TV. Tout est fait pour que vous soyez à l'aise. Le quartier est très safe et calme. Tout était parfait! Encore Merci pour tout.
Géraldine

This is an incredible place to stay in Brooklyn. It's conveniently located, quiet, calm, and in the middle of a family-oriented neighborhood where people say hi on the street. Lori and Jen are great hosts -- I stayed with them for almost three months and I couldn't recommend them more highly. Lego and Blue (the feline hosts) are sweet and hilarious, the amenities are spot-on, and value is fantastic. (Can't beat having a Netflix account and TV in the guest room, either.) This is definitely the first listing I'd send to a friend visiting New York.

My boyfriend and l spent some days in Lori and Jen's apartment and we must say we were very happy with that. The girls are very kind, they have a helpful attitude when you need something. They saved a space for our stuff both in the bathroom and in the kitchen. The whole apartment is always clean and orderly and there are all the comforts. 
I absolutely recommend this apartment.
Thank you Lori and Jen :)

Lori's home is a blissful oasis of calm. It's conveniently located (short walk from F train Church Ave. station), squeaky clean, quiet and charming, and beautifully appointed, with allowances and amenities for guests that go above and beyond the expected. The guest room is sunny and breezy and has plenty of storage (and a very nice TV!) Lori and Jen are warm and welcoming and interesting; very accommodating and happy to engage, but also happy to allow their guests absolute privacy. Most notably, this is a home is filled with kindness, where mutual respect is honored.
Lori and Jen got a beatiful place in Brooklyn. We got a great time in NY. Their place is near the subway and the neighborhood is quiet and safe. They were helpful and kind to us. Many thanks!

Me and my wife had a great time in NYC, specially because we had a great and comfy place to rest after a long long day walking and knowing new places in NYC. The experience was fantastic and we'll defo recommend Lory and Jen's place to our friends. They're very kind and also we love cats so Lego and Blue (their lovely cats) were a plus!! The flat location is also a plus.. 2 blocks from the tube station. Jen and Lori, thank you so much for having us.
I would highly recommend this property. The bedroom and the rest of the home was immaculate and comfortable, and the host, Lori was very nice and accommodating.
Lori has been very nice, helpful and responsive. I highly recommend her as a host !
The apartment is bright and airy, and Lori is very accommodating!

Thank you so much for everything Lori. We really appreciate everything that you have done for us. Including looking after our Dr Martens.. :-) lol.. We will see you soon i wish you and Jen a lovely Christmas and New Year's not forgetting Lego and Blue, they are the best.  I would highly recommend anyone to stay with you guys

Lori es excelente anfitriona, su respuesta es rápida, esta pendiente de que se encuentre bien todo, mi amiga con la que viaje se enfermo y Loro le a regalado unas pastillas y te para que se sintiera mejor.

name: Luxury Room (rm2), 5 mins from Columbia
summary: *Note: Changed furnitures The newly renovated apartment is clean, and large with a sunny open space for living. Conveniently located 7-10 minutes walk from 2 train stations (red 1, 2, 3, line and blue/orange A, B, C, D line),  5 minutes away from Columbia University. The walk-up 3rd floor apartment features 4 bedrooms, a fully equipped separate kitchen with LED mood lights, a sun-lit living room with two sectional sofa. *Note that our kitty cat will be staying with us
space: Room 2 is equipped with:  • Queen sized bed  • 2 large windows • Air-Conditioner + Heater • Mini fridge • Closet   • Blowdryer  • Fullbody mirror • Power outlet + USB Charging port
description: *Note: Changed furnitures The newly renovated apartment is clean, and large with a sunny open space for living. Conveniently located 7-10 minutes walk from 2 train stations (red 1, 2, 3, line and blue/orange A, B, C, D line),  5 minutes away from Columbia University. The walk-up 3rd floor apartment features 4 bedrooms, a fully equipped separate kitchen with LED mood lights, a sun-lit living room with two sectional sofa. *Note that our kitty cat will be staying with us Room 2 is equipped with:  • Queen sized bed  • 2 large windows • Air-Conditioner + Heater • Mini fridge • Closet   • Blowdryer  • Fullbody mirror • Power outlet + USB Charging port • Everything in your room: Blowdryer, Bluetooth speaker, Air conditioner, Heater, Mini fridge • Kitchen: oven, microwave, fridge, blender, rice cooker, toaster, gas stove,  bartend shaker, Keurig coffee machine (we provide free coffee!)  • Living Room: Vinyl Player, bluetooth speaker, Electrical Fireplace • Super Speed 400 mbp Wifi, Bathroom wi
neighborhood_overview: Located in Manhattan, just north of Morningside Heights and southwest of Harlem with a variety of restaurants, bars, convenient stores and is located within walking distance. The neighborhood is safe, friendly and lively. The neighborhood is filled with Columbia students.  The apartment is centrally located between 2 subway lines which makes getting nearly anywhere in Manhattan easy. In addition, there's an app that allows you to travel to anywhere within Manhattan and certain areas in Brooklyn and Queens for just $6. Ask me for more information.
notes: Laundry: There's no laundry in the unit, but there's a free pick up/drop off (usually takes 1 day to wash, dry & fold) laundromat just two blocks away. It costs $1.25/pound. I can give you the contact if you need.
transit: • 7 min. walk no. 1,2,3 (Red) Train line/ A,C,D,E (Blue) Train line • 2 stops, or 17 mins walk to Central Park! • 5 minutes walk to Riverside Park • 3 minutes walk to Manhattan School of Music • 5 mins walk to Columbia University • 3 stops express train (C/D train; 20-30 min) to Times Square Subway Train: The apartment is on West 123 street between Broadway and Amsterdam. It is centrally located between 2 subway lines which makes getting nearly anywhere in Manhattan easy. The two station names are "125th Street”, which are both 7-8 minutes away from the apartment. Please refer to the map that I uploaded in the photo album.  Parking:  There are street parkings just beneath the apartment. Please refer to the street signs on NYC daily street cleaning.  In addition, apart from Uber, there's an app that allows you to travel to anywhere within Manhattan for $6 that I usually use. Please ask me for more information!
access: • Everything in your room: Blowdryer, Bluetooth speaker, Air conditioner, Heater, Mini fridge • Kitchen: oven, microwave, fridge, blender, rice cooker, toaster, gas stove,  bartend shaker, Keurig coffee machine (we provide free coffee!)  • Living Room: Vinyl Player, bluetooth speaker, Electrical Fireplace • Super Speed 400 mbp Wifi, Bathroom with Bath tub
interaction: I am originally from Hong Kong. I'm a pre-medical student at Columbia and working part-time at two hospitals as a medical interpreter and research assistant. I am a friendly, reliable host and am always available to answer questions and offer advice on anything.
